subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|i}}: a man with a painted or tattooed chest â€“ original form of {{zh-l|*ç´‹}}. In current form, tattoo has vanished, so simply an outline of a man (head, outstretched arms, legs, chest). Compare {{zh-l|*å¤§}}, which has no chest.

subSections.text: The {{m|en|design}} and {{m|en|crest}} senses are more often spelled {{m|ja|ç´‹}}.

Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|ã‚ã‚„}}
Uncertain. Appears in texts from the early {{w|Heian period}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|ã‚ã‚„}}

# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|ç´‹}}, {{m|ja|ç¶¾}}}}
## a [[pattern]], a [[design]], especially one with [[diagonally]] [[crossing]] lines
## a [[diagonal]] [[crossing]]
## a [[flowery]] [[expression]] or [[turn of phrase]]
## a [[plot]], a [[scheme]]
## a [[refrain]] or recurring [[phrase]] in a piece of [[music]]
## a [[harder]] [[vein]] or [[grain]] in a leaf or piece of wood or bamboo
## a [[stain]], a [[blemish]]
## a [[mediator]], a [[go-between]] {{qualifier|apparently from the way that a go-between can make the relationship more indirect and indistinct}}
## a small indistinct [[fluctuation]] in a trend line
# {{qualifier|also spelled {{m|ja|ç¶¾}}, {{m|ja|çµ¢}}}}
## a kind of [[woven]] [[silk]] [[textile]] with a diagonally crossing pattern
## short for {{m|ja|ç¶¾ç¹”|tr=ayaori}}: a [[twill]] [[weave]]; someone who [[weave]]s [[twill]]
## short for {{m|ja|ç¶¾ç«¹|tr=ayadake}}: in a [[loom]], a [[bamboo]] [[pole]] placed between the [[heddle]] and the [[back beam]] or [[platen]], used to improve the handling
## short for {{m|ja|ç¶¾å–ã‚Š|tr=ayatori}}: [[cat's cradle]]

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: For the second group of senses, the {{m|ja|ç¶¾}} spelling is more common.
